required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low Dose Tadalafil for Treatment of Female OAB Syndrome: Short Term Follow up.
clinical_study.official_title: Low Dose Tadalafil 5mg for Treatment of Female Overactive Bladder Syndrome :6 Months Follow up

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of use of low dose tadalafil 5 mg daily for treatment of female OAB syndrome

detailed_description.textblock: 100 female patients with overactive bladder syndrome divided into 2 groups group A subjected to daily low dose tadalafil 5 mg and group B subjected to placebo . Both are evaluated as using OAB symptoms score for 6 months follow up

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of daily low dose tadalafil 5mg in treatment of female overactive bladder syndrome: 6 months follow up
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of efficacy of tadalafil 5 mg

clinical_study.condition: Female Patients With Overactive Bladder Syndrome or Female Patients With Urgency or Urgency Urinary Incontinence

arm_group.description: 50 patients subjected to Daily dose of tadalafil 5mg

intervention.description: Efficacy of daily low dose tadalafil 5mg for treatment of female overactive bladder syndrome or urgency with or without urgency urinary incontinence

study_pop.textblock: Females , any age, no neurologic abnormality, with OAB syndrome, urgency or urgency urinary incontinence

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- any female with overactive bladder syndrome, urgency with or without urgency urinary incontinence
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active Urinary tract infection
- neurologic abnormality
- Pure Stress urinary incontinence
